intro: Phaeocephalum glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered phaeocephalum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and evergreen, adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience in challenging environments.
